Reviews.Title: (UPDATED) Fantastic WiFi / Internet / SmartPhone Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: MamaMoon
Reviews.Content: First-- Quality:I think the picture quality of this camera is awesome. We have been using it for about 3 months now. The picture is clear enough where we can see by looking at the monitor if our daughter is breathing while she's sleeping. We can also see if her eyes are open, or if she spit up. The night vision is incredible, just as clear as with daylight. Before my daughter was born we used this camera as a security camera and it was perfect for that as well. We plan on purchasing one or two more to use as security cameras.The biggest con of this camera, at least with ours, has been audio. We have never gotten clear audio from either our PC or our iPhones. We have an AngelCare Movement & Sound Monitor and we use that for audio to monitor our daughter.Second-- Configuration:I did not find this camera nearly as hard to configure as it seems some others have. I found the instructions to be satisfactory. I would say I've had some experience with computers, but never with network configuration or installing anything like this.The DNS service the instructions tell you to use is no longer free. You can find free sources, but it's not built into their software the way DynDNS is. So, I just paid the $20 for a year of service from DynDNS and followed the instructions and it worked.I then paid $4.99 for the Foscam Surveillance Pro app on the iPhone. The app rocks. I can take screenshots or video, pan/tilt the camera, and there's a talk button as well so I can use the 2-way talk from my iPhone.In total it cost me about $110 and about 20 minutes to get this camera working. The average video baby monitor costs between $150 - $300 these days and are not viewable from your computer at work or on your smart phone. The downside to this would be that it will only work as long as your internet is working. Comcast screwed up royally over and over again when we moved and it took about 10 days for us to have internet, and therefore, no monitor during that time.Overall, if you're not computer illiterate, and you don't mind paying the $20 a year for DynDNS's services (or taking the time to figure out how to use a free service similar to it), I would recommend this camera for you.If you only plan on using this camera locally via WiFi (no web access) then you don't even need to worry about DynDNS or similar service. My husband and I will be buying more of these low-priced, high-quality cameras!UPDATE: It's now October 31st (happy halloween) and we've been using this camera for several months now. With our set-up I still have no complaints. In fact, the reason I'm back here is because we're ordering another one to put in another room in our house.It may be complicated to set-up in the beginning, but once it's ready, you're rewarded with clear picture, amazing night vision and the convenience of using this on my smart phone.I did bump it down from 5 stars to 4 stars because the audio feature is not really usable, although we've used it before if our other monitor is not within reach. There's a lag and lots of static. Still, I plan on ordering at least 2 more!

Reviews.Title: Not for the faint of heart
Reviews.Author: mdamazon
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this camera were great, overall, so I bought one to use as a baby monitor.  I consider myself in the middle when it comes to technical savvy.  This camera is not for the faint of heart of those that get confused by DHCP, IP, ActiveX downloads, death loops of error messages and so on.I was thrilled to find that the instructions were all contained on a 4x4, 20 page booklet....not a whole lot to do.  I like to have electronic copies of manuals so I hit their website and found that the actual installation and manual is 48 pages of dense text on letter sized paper...that was my first tip off that the install wasn't going to be easy.I tried the install on two different Windows 7 machines; one of which was brand new and, therefore, as pristine as a machine could get.  The software installed just fine in about 10 seconds each time. I rebooted as prompted.  I launched the IP Camera app, saw my camera listed as Annymous with the IP address, double clicked it (horrificly amateur user interface on that app by the way) and was taken to what looked like a control panel of sorts.There were virtual dials and knobs and controls to move the camera around.  Where one would normally see the image from the camera, I had a nice large black box with a smaller white box in the upper left hand corner which contained a red X...basically I needed to download and install an Active X control.  I was prompted to do this on both machines, I selected Install, gave the install app permission to install, and got some weird message saying that Windows had found a problem with the file.  My only option was OK so I clicked it and I was once again asked if I wanted to install.  Death loop.  The only way to end it was to hit No several times.This sounded like a Windows problem so I tried it on the other PC with the exact same results.  At that point, I was convinced that it was an install program issue, was indicative of how the product would function, and put the whole thing back in the box.Even the instructions are ambiguous.  Here are a few samples:"If you use Windows7 and could not find the icon on desktop after installing the IP camera tool, please check if the path of the camera software is correct.  For example, if it was pointing to C:\Windows\System32\IPCamera.exe.Then fix this by pointing the shortcut to the correct path C:\Windows\SysWOW64\IPCamera.exe. The shortcut should work without any problems."  - What?  Why not update your install program?"Please don't upgrade the firmware freely. Sometimes, your camera may be damaged if configured wrong during the upgrade. If your camera works well with the current firmware, we recommend not upgrading." - What is the purpose of a firmware update then?  Do they magically know to only include fixes that are causing every malfunction?"If you could not view living video after running the activeX. Only a red cross in the center of the video or just a black screen. Please change another port number to try. Don't use port 80.Use port 85, 8005 or 8100 to try."  What is living video?  Who taught this person grammar and sentence structure?  Who let them write end-user technical reference material?I am sure this is a good camera...for the married-to-your-computer type of person who thinks it is great to spend hours tweaking and configuring things knowing that you'll get to repeat it all in case of failure or new routers or whatever.  Not for me...I value my time far too much to waste another minute trying to tweak and fix my network, or decipher the first grade writing in the manual.

Reviews.Title: Works well for purpose
Reviews.Author: Emil
Reviews.Content: I had an old DLink IP cam from years ago. I gave that away so I was looking for a new one. Nothing really stood out on the Amazon site for wireless IP cameras - well, there were, but they were out of my price range. For me, I just needed to test the waters as far as wireless IP cameras were and the price swayed me to get this one. The camera is pretty good - in the dark, it works pretty well till about maybe 10 feet - after that, it's like looking into a black hole. The color during daylight is off, but otherwise, images look good. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great image quality
Reviews.Author: Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera is great as a baby camera or indoor security camera.  It has a lot features including wifi/wired access via http, ftp, msn, etc.  The night vision is very clear.  The documentation was sometimes hard to decipher.  Be sure to update the firmware!

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: A pain to set up the wireless and port forwarding, but a pleasure to have and use it when all said and done.

Reviews.Title: For the Money -- Can't be Beat
Reviews.Author: Joseph Dell
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note -- I have held a professional LVA (Low-Voltage Alarm) license in my state.  For the money the Foscam FI8918W is the best value out there! The picture quality in total darkness is astounding at 0-18 feet, and the 120 degree up and down, 300 degree left right pan feature is incredible!  Again for the money get at least one -- probably two, since the software will allow up to NINE on one router!  Did I mention you can set up visitor users with password protection.. Perhaps allow your alarm company to monitor while you are on vacation?

Reviews.Title: Great value, easy setup and very nice quality
Reviews.Author: T. Wiz "WZR"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these cameras to keep an eye on my house when I'm not home. The setup was quite easy and the remote access is very nice. I can even access the live video feed from my house on my iPhone. I'm quite pleased with this purchase. The camera also works well with Blue Iris software and multiple cameras.Update: After 6 months of use I am still very happy with this camera. I access it directly (using Firefox is better than IE with this) and I also use it with Blue Iris which can control up to 10 cameras (works great with this model) and do DVR. I also use a free iPhone app called Cam Viewer which controls this camera very nicely and works well with the iPhone and iPad. If you want to access through the intrenet you will need to have internet service with a public IP address and configure the port forwarding on your router to point at the camera's internal IP address. I guess I should buy another one - I am a fan.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money
Reviews.Author: C4S2K3
Reviews.Content: I had no trouble setting up the camera following the instructions and included software. We have a Mac household and I know some folks have reported difficulties when using some FOSCAM items with Macs, but I had no issues. I use Evocam software to monitor a couple of WiFi cameras, including this one. Currently using this one in our baby's room. The nighttime image is EXCELLENT. The IR LEDs light up pretty much the entire room. Evocam's web server makes it easy to access our video feeds from our iPhones and iPads and that is primarily how we use this camera.On the down side, the web page-based control of the camera is a bit clunky and does require you to provide your login credentials twice in order to view the camera. This gets old if you intend to use the camera directly. Not an issue if you have some other method of accessing the video feed (such as Evocam or some similar SW package) since that software is maintaining the connection to the camera feed for you. One other negative is that getting audio from the camera is also flaky at best, or may not work at all depending on your situation. In my case, we've always had an audio baby monitor in place so I was not looking for an audio-capable solution. To recap the negatives, if you intend to use the camera directly, the interface is not the most convenient. If audio is a priority for you, this camera may not work out for you either.Overall, very pleased with this product and the price is a bargain when compared to other options for monitoring our baby's room. Some such "baby cams" are selling for upwards of $300.

Reviews.Title: Makes a bit of noise when it moves
Reviews.Author: Gregory
Reviews.Content: Works well, actually great, kinda difficult to set up, the video will make you laugh if you listen to the computers A's at the end of words.I'm planning on getting another Foscam, the app is terrible from foscam use another one and you'll be set

Reviews.Title: Use this to keep an eye on the driveway
Reviews.Author: A Little Bit Geeky
Reviews.Content: This camera works well. Haven't used any of the recording features so I can't comment on them. The colors are washed out looking because it doesn't have an ir-cut filter but I knew that would be the case so it doesn't bother me. The IR lights can be turned off and I wanted that since I often use it at night and the IR lights impair vision if the camera is placed behind a window. Works great to see who is in the driveway at night.

Reviews.Title: Pretty great camera
Reviews.Author: Sarah Murphy
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of this camera. The biggest hurdle was figuring out how to set it up. The camera comes with step by step instructions, which ultimately had all the information I needed to set them up the way I wanted to set them up, but it took me a couple hours (mind you, I'm not a networking guru). Now they're set up and my husband and I can "dial in" and peek at our daughter while away at work all day. The foscam app is pretty awesome too, not only can you control the camera, but you can adjust the position and talk through the mic on the camera, which is an awesome way to tell our dog to get off the couch when we're not home:)

Reviews.Title: Nice ip cam
Reviews.Author: Ecologist
Reviews.Content: I have several web cams for monitoring our country home - all ip cameras.  This was just a frivolous purchase, but it is very reasonably priced and easy to set up if you have some experience.  It works very well and I like it a lot.  I did have to buy an app for $6 that works beautifully (Foscam Pro) for mobile devices.  Be wary of others - two others I brought simply did not work or did not work well.  I think they should provide their own APP, one that works well, and their instructions were rather minimal.  Still I recommend it and would not hesitate to get another.

Reviews.Title: Best wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Sunny D "StarBucks Addict"
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup - just follow instructions. Not that clear but it is perfect for what we needed it for - we use the camera to keep an eye on our baby.

Reviews.Title: If you don't care about audio - this is your camera.
Reviews.Author: S. Anderson
Reviews.Content: The camera is great, and it responds great to a number of apps I have tried.  If you want to use this as a baby monitor (which we are), and audio is important for you - then this is NOT your camera.  The audio is awful.  And don't buy into the motion capture stuff either - it does nothing more than grab a few stills and email it to you.  So if you have it turned on, your inbox is going to get its butt kicked if someone is hanging around the room you are monitoring.I still gave it 3 stars because it does plenty for the price.  Would I buy it again for use as a baby monitor? No.  Am I happy using it in my toddlers room where audio isn't important? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: Bait and Switch
Reviews.Author: Mercy2915
Reviews.Content: I received a box that was labeled FI8918W but the camera inside was a 8909 (older model). Didnt figure that out until the return period has expired. Plus this didnt work with my NVR. You can only use it with a computer. Wont integrate into your professional NVR without major tinkering and software tweaks. But this and roll the dice.

Reviews.Title: Might have been nice...
Reviews.Author: Bon Vivant (life's too short for mediocrity) ...
Reviews.Content: ...had it ever properly interfaced with my wifi router.  This little camera worked well when wired via ethernet to my router, but - for some reason (and I explicitly followed the instructions provided, as well as repeatedly experiencing the videos AND online forum) it recognized my wifi's existence but refused to cooperate with it.  And another deal-breaking problem - if I set it up wired, but disconnected the ethernet and then reconnected it: the entire set-up (including recognition of log-in) disappeared.  Requiring a full set-up with disc and full re-boot of my computer.  I worked with it for three weeks, off and on, trying every solution I could come up with - before finally throwing in the towel. At our remote location, we're prone to momentary power interruptions which would have the same effect of disconnecting/reconnecting the ethernet via power loss to the router - and there was no way I was going to deal with a full reprogramming whenever THAT occurred.  This camera should simply be programmed to connect and be off and running with only a small amount of NON-counter-intuitive programming, but that isn't the case.  So: back to Amazon, I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: AlanK
Reviews.Content: I  bought several cameras over 14 months ago to monitor my vacation home.  Installation went well and they have not failed me except one which refused to  go wireless. Fortunately, I was able to wire it to the router and it works fine. I use  foscam surveillance pro application for my iPad and works flawlessly.  On my wish list, I would like see these cameras to alert me by email when the ip address is changed by the service provider. Final point they are robust as I have been using them for the last 14 months.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't use it due to cable company restrictions - So Beware!
Reviews.Author: mcdearone
Reviews.Content: Cannot use it because our cable service company will not allow users to flow things over the internet live - We would somehow have to purchase a website or something (I dont even understand it is so complicated) in order to use this to see our dogs at home live while working during the day time. So it has never been used and sits in the box for a year now.
